trans-unit.source: Identifies the level type for a switch.
This attribute is intended to be applied to all classes that inherit from the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Switch> class.
The purpose of the attribute is to identify the type that specifies the switch criteria of the switch.

Each switch determines whether a trace is to be written, based on whether an event type matches or exceeds the value of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchLevelAttribute.SwitchLevelType%2A> property for the switch.
The type used for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.SwitchLevelAttribute.SwitchLevelType%2A> property varies for different switches.

For example, the switch level type for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.BooleanSwitch> class is <xref:System.Boolean>, and the switch level type for the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSwitch> class is <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceLevel>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Diagnostics.SwitchLevelAttribute"></xref> class, specifying the type that determines whether a trace should be written.

The `switchLevelType` parameter identifies the type that is used by the switch to determine if a trace should be written; for example, the type of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSwitch.Level%2A> property of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceSwitch> class is <xref:System.Diagnostics.TraceLevel>.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that determines whether a trace should be written.
Gets or sets the type that determines whether a trace should be written.

The level property of a switch is not necessarily named `Level`; for example, the level property of the <xref:System.Diagnostics.BooleanSwitch> class is <xref:System.Diagnostics.BooleanSwitch.Enabled%2A>.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that determines whether a trace should be written.
The set operation failed because the value is `null`.
